item.description:

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): Unit Switches Immediately to 45 RPM After Pressing Start
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 (5503) turntable being restored exhibited a peculiar issue during initial testing. Upon starting, the tonearm moved as expected but the speed immediately switched to 45 RPM. Pressing the 33 RPM button temporarily resolved the issue, but the speed reverted back upon release. This unusual behavior pointed to a potential problem with transistors TR3 or TR2. Examining the circuit diagram, we can see how speed selection operates: The speed control mechanism utilizes a flip-flop circuit with transistors TR3 and TR4...
